publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3137 Irene McGugan: UEFA Champions League Final—That the Parliament congratulates both the City of Glasgow and the Scottish Football Association for ensuring that the UEFA Champions League Final 2002 was an outstanding success; notes the vast amount of work involved in staging such a prestigious event; commends all those involved in the preparation and aftermath; welcomes the potential benefits of showcasing Hampden Park, Glasgow and Scotland across the world to a global audience of one billion people across 200 countries, and hopes that Scottish football, the Scottish people and tourism in Scotland will reap the rewards for years to come.
S1M-3137 UEFA Champions League Final (lodged on 21 May 2002) Michael Matheson*, Stewart Stevenson*
S1M-3137 UEFA Champions League Final (lodged on 21 May 2002) Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S1M-3137 Irene McGugan: UEFA Champions League Final—That the Parliament congratulates both the City of Glasgow and the Scottish Football Association for ensuring that the UEFA Champions League Final 2002 was an outstanding success; notes the vast amount of work involved in staging such a prestigious event; commends all those involved in the preparation and aftermath; welcomes the potential benefits of showcasing Hampden Park, Glasgow and Scotland across the world to a global audience of one billion people across 200 countries, and hopes that Scottish football, the Scottish people and tourism in Scotland will reap the rewards for years to come. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Stewart Stevenson, Mr Kenny MacAskill
S1M-3137 UEFA Champions League Final (lodged on 21 May 2002) Shona Robison*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-3137 UEFA Champions League Final (lodged on 21 May 2002) Fergus Ewing*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-3137 UEFA Champions League Final (lodged on 21 May 2002) Michael Russell*
S1M-3137 UEFA Champions League Final (lodged on 21 May 2002) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-3137 UEFA Champions League Final (lodged on 21 May 2002) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3137 UEFA Champions League Final (lodged on 21 May 2002) Brian Adam*
